Description: THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF THE KLAMATH TRIBES' CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE ADMINISTRATIVE SAVINGS AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN THE TRIBE AND EPA. THIS AGREEMENT SUPPORTS ACTIVITIES TO PROTECT AND MAINTAIN AIR, WATER, LAND AND DATA QUALITY. $99,992 IN NATIONAL TRIBAL 319 COMPETITIVE FUNDING AWARDED UNDER EPA-OW-OWOW-20-01 IS OBLIGATED AS PART OF THIS NEW AWARD FUNDING ACTION.

DESCRIPTION:THE PROPOSED PROJECT SEEKS TO IMPLEMENT E-REPORTING INFRASTRUCTURE FOR COLLECTING PUBLIC WATER SUPPLY DATA AND INFORMATION. MTDEQ WILL REDUCE ITS DATA COLLECTION BURDENS BY IMPLEMENTING A PUBLIC WATER SUPPLY COMPLIANCE-BASED E-REPORTING AND INTEGRATING WITH FEDERAL SYSTEMS INCLUDING SDWIS. THE PUBLIC WATER SUPPLY WEB BASED INFRASTRUCTURE IMPLEMENTATION PWSWII PROJECT IMPROVES DATA CONSISTENCY BY TRANSITIONING MTDEQ TO THE USE OF WEB SERVICES FOR PUBLIC WATER SUPPLY DATA COLLECTION AND REPORTING. THE USE OF WEB SERVICES TO PROVIDE UP-TO-DATE PUBLIC WATER DATA ENSURES DATA IS REPORTED CONSISTENTLY AND IS USEFUL TO OTHER REGULATORY JURISDICTIONS AND THE PUBLIC. GOALS INCLUDE EXPANDING E-REPORTING CAPABILITIES, INCREASING DATA ACCESS AND AVAILABILITY, AND PROVIDING UP-TO-DATE DRINKING WATER INFORMATION AND REQUIREMENTS QUICKER, THEREBY IMPROVING ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION.
AWARD PURPOSE: TO ENHANCE IT AND DATA MANAGEMENT CAPABILITIES THAT FACILITATE THE ELECTRONIC COLLECTION, REPORTING, EXCHANGE, SHARING AND INTEGRATION OF THE FULL RANGE OF DATA THAT INFORMS THE BUSINESS OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION.
ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE: DEVELOPING OPERATOR CERTIFICATION DATABASE WITH PUBLIC FACING INTERFACE; DEVELOPING A LEAD AND COPPER DATABASE WITH GIS AND PORTAL APPLICATIONS FOR ELECTRONIC REPORTING; DEVELOPING MONITORING SCHEDULE REPORT PROGRAMMING FOR PUBLIC WATER SYSTEMS; AND DEVELOPING ELECTRONIC REPORTING FOR PUBLIC WATER SYSTEMS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE: IMPLEMENTATION OF A PUBLIC INTERFACE FOR PUBLIC WATER SYSTEM COMPLIANCE REPORTING; THE CREATION OF AN ELECTRONIC MONITORING SCHEDULE REPORT; DEVELOPMENT OF ELECTRONIC REPORTING FOR MONTHLY OPERATION REPORTS FOR PUBLIC WATER SYSTEMS; DEVELOPMENT OF LEAD AND COPPER DATABASE AND GIS APPLICATION FOR ELECTRONIC REPORTING; AND PRODUCTION OF PUBLIC WATER SUPPLY DATA PORTAL FOR SAMPLE DATA INFORMATION.EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: IMPROVED PUBLIC WATER SUPPLY DATA MANAGEMENT AND DATA SECURITY; A COMMON REPOSITORY FOR REFERENCE VALUES; EXPANDED PUBLIC WATER SUPPLY DATA ACCESS AND AVAILABILITY; INTEGRATION OF STATE'S PUBLIC WATER DATA THROUGH WEB SERVICES; CLEARLY DEFINED REPORTING REQUIREMENTS FOR REGULATED FACILITIES; AND AVAILABILITY OF WEB SERVICES FOR DATA ANALYTICS AND SHARING. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE: WATER AND WASTEWATER OPERATORS AND THE PUBLIC.

DESCRIPTION:THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL ENABLE THE UPPER MATTAPONI INDIAN TRIBE TO EMPLOY WATER QUALITY MONITORING, DEVELOP QUALITY ASSURANCE AND QUALITY CONTROL PROCEDURES TO SUPPORT HIGH QUALITY DATA, BUILD SERVICES FOR AUTOMATED DATA SUBMISSION, AND BUILD TRIBAL CAPACITY THROUGH TRAINING AND MENTORING. THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL ALSO ALLOW THE TRIBE TO ITERATIVELY ADAPT AND REVISE THEIR CURRENT EFFORTS TO DEVELOP A MONITORING PLAN AND DATA MANAGEMENT PLAN AND BUILD TECHNICAL CAPACITY FOR CONTINUED USE AND MAINTENANCE OF THE TOOLS DEVELOPED IN THE PROJECT.

AWARD PURPOSE: TO ENHANCE IT AND DATA MANAGEMENT CAPABILITIES THAT FACILITATE THE ELECTRONIC COLLECTION, REPORTING, EXCHANGE, SHARING AND INTEGRATION OF THE FULL RANGE OF DATA THAT INFORMS THE BUSINESS OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION.ACTIVITIES:DEVELOPING WATER QUALITY DATA SYSTEM AND BUILDING AND MAINTAINING DATA MANAGEMENT CAPACITY.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE: TOOLS FOR AUTOMATED DATA SUBMISSION SERVICES, QAPP, QA/QC PROCEDURES, AND DATA ANALYSIS AND BUILD DATA MANAGEMENT CAPACITY TO SUPPORT CONTINUED USE AND MAINTENANCE OF TOOLS AND SYSTEMS AND FUTURE DEVELOPMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL DATA STREAMS. 

EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: ENHANCE TRIBE'S ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS AND THE ABILITY TO MANAGE AND SHARE ENVIRONMENTAL DATA ELECTRONICALLY WITH TRIBAL GOVERNMENT, EN PARTNERS, TRIBAL CITIZENS, AND CHESAPEAKE BAY STAKEHOLDERS TO INFORM AND IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY AND DEVELOPMENT OF A TRIBAL WATER PROGRAM- INCLUDING ESTABLISHING WATER QUALITY MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS AND MONITORING STRATEGY.

INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE: THE UPPER MATTAPONI INDIAN TRIBE, OTHER TRIBAL COMMUNITIES, AND THE BROADER CHESAPEAKE BAY WATERSHED COMMUNITY.

DESCRIPTION:THE STANDING ROCK SIOUX TRIBE WILL FURTHER EXPAND THE CAPABILITIES OF THE TRIBAL CONSORTIUM TO HAVE A MORE STREAMLINED FLOW OF DATA TO THE EXCHANGE NETWORK BY DEVELOPING A MOBILE APP FOR FIELD DATA AND ALSO PROVIDING TRAINING RESOURCES FOR TRIBES TO BUILD CAPACITY AS A CONSORTIUM AND AS INDIVIDUAL TRIBAL PROGRAMS.

AWARD PURPOSE: TO ENHANCE IT AND DATA MANAGEMENT CAPABILITIES THAT FACILITATE THE ELECTRONIC COLLECTION, REPORTING, EXCHANGE, SHARING AND INTEGRATION OF THE FULL RANGE OF DATA THAT INFORMS THE BUSINESS OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION. ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE: CREATING A MOBILE APPLICATION FOR ENTERING FIELD MEASUREMENTS OFFLINE; AND PROVIDING OUTREACH AND ASSISTANCE FOR USING THESE NEW FEATURES.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE: DEPLOYMENT OF THE REGION 8 MOBILE DATA ENTRY APPLICATION; END USER DOCUMENTATION AND/OR BASIC TRAINING MATERIALS; AND OUTREACH AND TRAINING TO TRIBAL MEMBERS.

EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: REGION 8 TRIBES WILL HAVE A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THEIR FIELD DATA ENTRY PROCESS; LESS TIME WILL BE NEEDED TO SUBMIT FIELD RESULTS TO EPA'S WQX / WQP; REGION 8 TRIBES WILL HAVE A STREAMLINED PROCESS THAT SIMPLIFIES FIELD DATA ENTRY; TRIBES' DATA WILL BE CONSOLIDATED INTO ONE, WQX COMPATIBLE DATABASE; TRIBES WILL BE TRAINED ON THE USE OF THE NEW TOOLS AND CAPABILITIES; TRIBAL WATER QUALITY PROGRAMS WILL INCREASE THEIR DATA ENTRY AND ANALYSIS EFFICIENCY; TRIBAL AND EPA WILL HAVE A BETTER DIALOGUE AND CAPABILITY TO STREAMLINE THEIR DATA ENTRY, QA, AND ANALYSIS PROCESS(ES); EPA WILL RECEIVE TRIBAL WATER QUALITY PROGRAM DATA IN A MORE TIMELY MANNER; AND REGION 8 TRIBAL WATER QUALITY PROGRAMS WILL GAIN MORE TIME FOR ANALYSIS AND QA OF THEIR DATA, RATHER THAN JUST MAKING THE MAIN FOCUS THE IMPORT/SUBMISSION PROCESS.

INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE: REGION 8 TRIBES AND TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM STAFF.

DESCRIPTION:KANSAS STATE UNIVERSITY SEEKS TO WORK WITH FIVE TRIBES EXPERIENCED WITH A VARIETY OF SITE DATA MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS, TO CREATE WAYS TO EASILY OBTAIN, CONSOLIDATE, ANALYZE AND SHARE ENVIRONMENTAL LAND AND FACILITY DATA, FOR INTERNAL TRIBAL EFFECTIVE ENVIRONMENTAL DECISION MAKING WITH PASSWORD PROTECTED ACCOUNTS, AND TO SHARE SELECT SUBSETS OF THAT DATA FOR FUNDING APPLICATIONS AND REPORTING PURPOSES. THE PROJECT GOALS ARE TO ESTABLISH APPLICATION PROGRAM INTERFACES (APIS) TO MOVE DATA OF CHOICE IN AND OUT OF A CENTRALIZED NODE/DATABASE TO AND FROM EXISTING OPEN SOURCE TRIBAL ANALYTICAL TOOLS AND PUBLICLY AVAILABLE DATA, AND TO WORK WITH PARTICIPATING TRIBES ON PROOFS OF CONCEPTS.

AWARD PURPOSE: TO ENHANCE IT AND DATA MANAGEMENT CAPABILITIES THAT FACILITATE THE ELECTRONIC COLLECTION, REPORTING, EXCHANGE, SHARING AND INTEGRATION OF THE FULL RANGE OF DATA THAT INFORMS THE BUSINESS OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE: PROVIDING EQUITABLE ACCESS TO NATIONAL DATA; PROVIDING AN ONLINE CENTRAL DATABASE THAT MAY BE ACCESSED AND USED BY MULTIPLE TRIBAL DEPARTMENTS TO STREAMLINE DATA SHARING AS WELL AS DOCUMENT AND TRACK INSPECTIONS AND COMPLIANCE; AND PROVIDING AN ONLINE CENTRALIZED DATABASE, THAT MAY BE ACCESSED ANYTIME, TO STORE AND SHARE DATA SO THAT INFORMED DECISIONS MAY BE MADE REGARDING SITE PRIORITIZATION AND CLEANUP, AND PROMOTE EQUITY IN DATA ACCESS, MAKING MORE TOOLS ACCESSIBLE NATIONALLY, TO TRIBES AND ANY OTHER TYPES OF COMMUNITIES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE: EQUITABLE ACCESS TO DATA SO TRIBES IN OTHER UNDERSERVED AND OVERBURDENED COMMUNITIES CAN CLEAN UP AND RESTORE LAND; IDENTIFICATION OF CONDITIONS THAT MAY PRESENT IMMINENT AND SUBSTANTIAL ENDANGERMENT TO HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT AND THEREBY WARRANT A RESPONSE; IDENTIFICATION OF POTENTIALLY OR KNOWN CONTAMINATED SITES IMPACTING GROUNDWATER AND WATERSHEDS AND PRIORITIZE THOSE SITES FOR CLEANUP; AND IDENTIFICATION OF POTENTIALLY OR KNOWN CONTAMINATED SITES IMPACTING SOIL AND OTHER ENVIRONMENTAL MEDIA AND PRIORITIZE THOSE SITES FOR CLEANUP.

EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: EMPOWER AND BUILD CAPACITY OF TRIBAL AND NON-TRIBAL COMMUNITIES TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; IMPROVED COMPLIANCE MONITORING, TRACKING, AND REPORTING TO DETERMINE IF REGULATED ENTITIES ARE COMPLYING WITH ENVIRONMENTAL LAWS AND PERMIT CONDITIONS; PROTECT PUBLIC HEALTH FROM THE RISK OF EXPOSURE TO REGULATED AND EMERGING CONTAMINANTS IN DRINKING AND SOURCE WATERS BY PRIORITIZING CLEANUPS OF CONTAMINATED PROPERTIES; PROTECT PUBLIC HEALTH FROM THE RISK OF EXPOSURE TO CONTAMINANTS AND RESTORE LAND TO SAFE AND PRODUCTIVE USES TO IMPROVE COMMUNITIES.

INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE: PARTICIPATING TRIBES.

DESCRIPTION:THE PROPOSED PROJECT SEEKS TO MODERNIZE THE KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENT'S DATA WAREHOUSE, REBUILD ATTENDANT FUNCTIONS, CAPTURE ADDITIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL DATA, AND IMPROVE TIMELY UPLOAD TO WQX AS WELL AS INCREASED ACCESS TO DATA THROUGH WEB MAP APPLICATIONS. THE GOALS OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE ENSURING CLEAN AND SAFE WATER FOR COMMUNITIES THROUGH PROVIDING HIGHER QUALITY WATER DATA.

AWARD PURPOSE: TO ENHANCE IT AND DATA MANAGEMENT CAPABILITIES THAT FACILITATE THE ELECTRONIC COLLECTION, REPORTING, EXCHANGE, SHARING AND INTEGRATION OF THE FULL RANGE OF DATA THAT INFORMS THE BUSINESS OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE: COMPLETING AN INVENTORY OF KDHE AMBIENT WATER QUALITY MONITORING DATA; DEFINING THE BOUNDARIES OF THE NEW WATER QUALITY MONITORING DATABASE AND DESIGNING ITS ARCHITECTURE; DEVELOPING AND TESTING CONNECTIVITY OF THE BUILT WATER QUALITY MONITORING DATABASE TO CRITICAL APPLICATIONS AND DATABASES; AND BUILDING A TOOL TO QUERY AND EXPORT DATA FROM THE WATER QUALITY MONITORING DATABASE FOR BATCH UPLOADS TO WQX WEB.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE: INVENTORY OF EXISTING DATA, REVIEW OF DATA STRUCTURE, AND CATALOG OF APPLICATIONS; ENTERPRISE LEVEL WATER QUALITY DATABASE ARCHITECTURE AND FRONT END; API CONNECTIVITY TO OTHER AGENCY ENTERPRISE DATABASES AND APPLICATIONS; AND UTILITY FOR EXPORT OF WQX-COMPATIBLE DATA.

EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: INVENTORY DATA BOTH INSIDE AND OUTSIDE THE EXISTING ENTERPRISE DATABASE, DOCUMENT FUNCTIONS, CAPTURE PROGRAM HISTORY, INTERVIEW USERS, RESEARCH TAXONOMIC DATA HANDLING, DEFINE NEEDS, AND PRODUCE DOCUMENTATION OF SUFFICIENT DETAIL TO SUPPORT LAUNCH OF A REBUILD; ARCHITECTURE AND BASIC FRONT END FUNCTIONS OF A NEW ENTERPRISE LEVEL WATER QUALITY MONITORING DATABASE; CONNECTIVITY OF THE NEW WATER QUALITY MONITORING DATABASE TO EXISTING AGENCY DATABASES AND APPLICATIONS, INCLUDING PUBLIC-FACING GEOSPATIAL DATABASES; AND ABILITY TO CREATE SEAMLESS EXPORTS OF FLAT FILES SUITABLE FOR DIRECT UPLOAD TO WQX WEB.

INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE: ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGERS, THE REGULATED COMMUNITY, AND THE PUBLIC.

DESCRIPTION:THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL ALLOW THE PENNSYLVANIA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY TO ENHANCE THE PENNSYLVANIA DEP'S ATTAINS DATA FLOW TOOL. THE SECOND GOAL IS TO ENHANCE DEP'S WQX TOOL TO ADD ADDITION BIOLOGICAL, PHYSICAL HABITAT, AND METRIC DATA NOT PREVIOUSLY TRANSFERRED. THE THIRD GOAL IS TO DELIVER AN APPROACH DOCUMENT FOR DEP'S WATER QUALITY PROGRAM OUTLINING DATA/SENSORS INTEGRATION WITH EXISTING SYSTEMS AND RECOMMENDING A PATHWAY TO PUBLISH THESE DATA AND METADATA IN OPEN FORMATS.

AWARD PURPOSE: TO ENHANCE IT AND DATA MANAGEMENT CAPABILITIES THAT FACILITATE THE ELECTRONIC COLLECTION, REPORTING, EXCHANGE, SHARING AND INTEGRATION OF THE FULL RANGE OF DATA THAT INFORMS THE BUSINESS OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION.'
ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE: ENHANCING PENNSYLVANIA STATE ATTAINS DATA FLOW TOOL; ENHANCING PENNSYLVANIA WATER QUALITY EXCHANGE TOOL; AND DEVELOPING A CONTINUOUS WATER QUALITY MONITORING APPROACH WHITEPAPER.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE: WQX AND ATTAINS WORKFLOWS INTEGRATION; ATTAINS OUTBOUND RESTFUL SERVICES IMPLEMENTED WITHIN THE PA STATE ATTAINS DATAFLOW TOOL; WQX SCHEMA 3.0 WITH DEP'S BIOLOGICAL PHYSICAL HABITAT, AND METRIC DATA VIA ON2 TO EPA; AND AN APPROACH DOCUMENT FOR PA WATER QUALITY PROGRAM OUTLINING DATA/SENSORS INTEGRATION WITH EXISTING SYSTEMS AND PUBLISHING HE DATA AND METADATA IN OPEN FORMATS.

EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: INCREASED PROGRAMMATIC EFFICIENCY AND PRODUCTION OF MORE ACCURATE WATER QUALITY DETERMINATIONS TO INCREASE TRANSPARENCY AND INTERAGENCY COORDINATION; INCREASED PUBLIC ACCESS TO LARGE DATASETS WITH WATER QUALITY INFORMATION TO ENHANCE PUBLIC TRANSPARENCY; INCREASE DEP'S CONTINUOUS DATA MONITORING TO HELP DEVELOP TOOLS THAT WILL PROTECT

INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE: STATE OF PENNSYLVANIA DEP STAFF WORKING WITH WATER QUALITY DATA; COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND FEDERAL AND PUBLIC PARTNERS LOOKING FOR CURRENT WATER QUALITY DATA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS PROJECT SEEKS TO MODERNIZE THE UTAH DEQ TIER 2 SUBMISSION PORTAL BY DEVELOPING AN APPLICATION PROGRAMMING INTERFACE (API) AND AN UPDATED SUBMISSION PORTAL THAT WILL ALLOW FUTURE FUNCTIONALITY FOR ANALYZING AND SHARING TIER 2 DATA, DECREASE SUBMISSION ERRORS, AND ALLOW THE INTEGRATION OF TIER 2 DATA INTO MULTIPLE APPLICATIONS AND SOFTWARE ENDPOINTS. THE API WILL ALSO ENABLE TIER 2 FACILITY REPORTS TO BE ACCESSED DIRECTLY FROM THE UDEQ INTERACTIVE MAP AND WILL ALLOW LOCAL EMERGENCY PLANNING COMMITTEES TO ACCESS TIER 2 FACILITY INFORMATION FOR BOTH ENFORCEMENT AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLANNING. GOALS INCLUDE ADVANCING ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE, ENFORCING ENVIRONMENTAL LAWS AND ENSURING COMPLIANCE, REDUCING WASTE AND PREVENTING CONTAMINATION TO REVITALIZE COMMUNITIES, AND TO ENSURE CHEMICAL SAFETY FOR PEOPLE AND THE ENVIRONMENT.
AWARD PURPOSE: TO ENHANCE IT AND DATA MANAGEMENT CAPABILITIES THAT FACILITATE THE ELECTRONIC COLLECTION, REPORTING, EXCHANGE, SHARING AND INTEGRATION OF THE FULL RANGE OF DATA THAT INFORMS THE BUSINESS OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE: DEVELOPING AN ENVIRONMENTAL DATA CATALOG AND IMPROVING ELECTRONIC DATA COLLECTION; AND ELECTRONIC INFORMATION AND DATA SHARING.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE: TIER 2 API;  BETA AND FINAL RELEASES OF UPDATED TIER 2 WEB PORTAL;  UPDATED INTERACTIVE MAP; JURISDICTIONAL DATA SHARING, PUBLIC DATA SHARING/GRAMA SEARCH; AND ANALYSIS AND DATA OUTPUT.
EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: UPDATED XML SCHEMA AND CONSISTENT DATA STRUCTURE, IMPROVED ACCURACY, AND USABILITY OF DATA, INTUITIVE ABILITY FOR USERS TO MANAGE THEIR OWN DATA, REDUCED DERR WORKLOAD, AND IMPROVED EFFICIENCY OF FUNCTIONALITIES; AND IMPROVED TRANSPARENCY AND PUBLIC/EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT UTILIZATION OF TIER 2 DATA, DATA SHARING WITHOUT DERR INTERVENTION, ANALYTICS, AND ACTIVE USE OF TIER 2 DATA INTERACTIVE MAP TO SUPPORT POWERFUL AND SPECIFIC DATA EXTRACTION.
INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE: LOCAL EMERGENCY PLANNING COMMITTEES; STATE OF UTAH

DESCRIPTION:THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL AID AND ENHANCE THE MISSOURI DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES' TRANSITION TO SDWIS MODERNIZATION BY MOVING TOWARDS WEB SERVICES FOR RETRIEVING DATA AS NEEDED. THE GRANT WOULD PAY FOR A SAFE WATER INFORMATION MANAGEMENT REPORTS WEB SOFTWARE TO REPLACE THE CURRENTLY USED SWIMR CENTRAL APPLICATION. MISSOURI WOULD ALSO IMPLEMENT THE UPGRADED VERSION OF SAFE WATER CONSUMER CONFIDENCE REPORTS. IN ADDITION TO THE INITIAL PURCHASE, THE GRANT WOULD ALSO BE APPLIED TO THE FIRST TWO YEARS OF MAINTENANCE COSTS ON THE PRODUCT.

AWARD PURPOSE: TO ENHANCE IT AND DATA MANAGEMENT CAPABILITIES THAT FACILITATE THE ELECTRONIC COLLECTION, REPORTING, EXCHANGE, SHARING AND INTEGRATION OF THE FULL RANGE OF DATA THAT INFORMS THE BUSINESS OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION. ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE: MODIFYING THE EXISTING SOFTWARE APPLICATIONS TO INTERACT AND SUPPORT MISSOURI'S TRANSITION TO AND USE OF FUTURE ITERATIONS OF SDWIS BY REPLACING THE OPEN DATABASE CONNECTIVITY (ODBC) TO REPRESENTATIONAL STATE TRANSFER (REST) APPLICATION PROGRAMMING INTERFACE (API) AND WEB SERVICE CALLS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE: UPGRADED VERSIONS OF SWIMR CENTRAL AND SWCCR

EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: SUPPORTS MISSOURI'S TRANSITION TO SDWIS MODERNIZATION WHILE MAINTAINING PRIMACY REQUIREMENTS ASSOCIATED WITH COMPLIANCE AND ENFORCEMENT; INCREASES ACCURACY AND ACCESSIBILITY OF DATA REPORTS; VIOLATIONS GENERATED IN A TIMELY MANNER; MONTHLY MONITORING SCHEDULES GENERATED TO ASSIST PDWB AND ESP IN ENSURING MONITORING COMPLIANCE; INCREASED PRODUCTIVITY OF STAFF BY REDUCING MANUAL PROCESSES; AND INCREASED EFFICIENCY IN CREATION OF ANNUAL CONSUMER CONFIDENCE REPORTS.

INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE: MISSOURI DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES' WATER PROTECTION PROGRAM STAFF AND SWIMR CENTRAL/SWCCR USERS

DESCRIPTION:THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL: 1) IMPLEMENT DIRECT IMPORT OF CERTAIN NARS MOBILE APP OUTPUTS INTO OWRB'S RE-USED DATA MANAGEMENT SYSTEM, 2) STREAMLINING AND IMPROVING WATER QUALITY MONITORING DATA CAPTURE, MANAGEMENT, AND ANALYSIS CAPABILITIES IN OUR RE-USED WATER QUALITY DATA MANAGEMENT SHARED PLATFORM, 3) IMPLEMENT DATA MANAGEMENT AND DATA SHARING IMPROVEMENTS AND SUPPORT FOR NALMS RE-USED DATA MANAGEMENT SYSTEM, AND 4) IMPLEMENT DATA CAPTURE AND DATA SHARING IMPROVEMENTS AND SUPPORT FOR NALMS RE-USED MOBILE APP.
AWARD PURPOSE: TO ENHANCE IT AND DATA MANAGEMENT CAPABILITIES THAT FACILITATE THE ELECTRONIC COLLECTION, REPORTING, EXCHANGE, SHARING AND INTEGRATION OF THE FULL RANGE OF DATA THAT INFORMS THE BUSINESS OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE: IMPLEMENTING DIRECT IMPORTING OF CERTAIN NARS MOBILE APP OUTPUTS INTO THE APPLICANT'S REUSED DATA MANAGEMENT SYSTEM; STREAMLINING AND IMPROVING WATER QUALITY MONITORING DATA CAPTURE, MANAGEMENT, AND ANALYSIS CAPABILITIES IN THE APPLICANT'S REUSED WATER QUALITY DATA MANAGEMENT SHARED PLATFORM; IMPLEMENTING DATA MANAGEMENT AND DATA SHARING IMPROVEMENTS AND SUPPORT FOR NALMS REUSED DATA MANAGEMENT SYSTEM; AND IMPLEMENTING DATA CAPTURE AND DATA SHARING IMPROVEMENTS FOR NALMS REUSED MOBILE APP.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE: DATABASE AND SOFTWARE CHANGES TO SUPPORT THE IMPORT OF JSON FILES FROM THE HABITAT ASSESSMENT OF THE NARS NLA MOBILE APP; DATABASE AND SOFTWARE CHANGES TO SUPPORT THE IMPORT OF JSON FILES FROM THE FISH GEAR AND SAMPLING, FISH COLLECTION, AND BENTHIC SAMPLE COLLECTION SECTIONS OF THE NRSA AND NLA APPS; DATABASE AND SOFTWARE CHANGES TO ENTER, IMPORT, DISPLAY, EXPORT AND PUBLISH VIA API WELL MONITORING POINT ADJUSTMENT VALUE INFORMATION; DATABASE AND SOFTWARE CHANGES TO IMPROVE DATA ACCESS AND SEARCHABILITY FOR DATA ANALYSIS AND ASSESSMENT; GREATER USAGE OF NALMS DIP-IN DATA MANAGEMENT AND WQX FLOW SYSTEM FOR NALMS TO AGGREGATE, ANALYZE, AND FLOW TO WQX DATA FROM OTHER VOLUNTEER PROJECTS THAT ARE NOT RELATED TO THE SECCHI DIP-IN, DATABASE AND SOFTWARE IMPROVEMENTS TO STREAMLINE BATCH DATA CAPTURE AND DATA ANALYSIS AND VISUALIZATION FOR BOTH NALMS ADMINISTRATIVE AND VOLUNTEER END USERS; AND MODIFICATIONS TO ADAPT AND SUPPORT OUR RE-USED MOBILE APP IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE EXPANDED USE OF OUR DATA MANAGEMENT SYSTEM.
EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: STREAMLINED REDUCTION OF COSTS FOR CAPTURE, VETTING, AND CONSOLIDATION OF FIELD MEASUREMENTS AND OBSERVATIONS; IMPROVED DATA QUALITY; IMPROVED TIMELINESS OF FIELD DATA AND OBSERVATIONS FOR BOTH STATE AND EPA USE; REDUCTION OF COST IN TIME WASTED IN ZEROING IN ON DATA DESIRED FOR ANALYSIS AND ASSESSMENT PURPOSES; INCREASED QUANTITY OF USEABLE VOLUNTEER DATA TO EPA AND NATIONAL WATER QUALITY PORTAL; IMPROVED CITIZEN SCIENTIST AND VOLUNTEER GROUP 'BUY-IN' AND PARTICIPATION THROUGH IMPROVED DATA ATTRIBUTION, SEARCHABILITY, AND ANALYSIS; AND MORE EFFICIENT DATA CAPTURE FOR BOTH NALMS AND CITIZEN SCIENTISTS.
INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE: NALMS RE-USED MOBILE APP USERS AND OTHER STATES OR TRIBES THAT STORE THEIR DATA IN AWQMS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PROPOSED PROJECT SEEKS TO ALLOW THE ENVIRONMENTAL DIVISIONS OF THE COLORADO DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENT TO FURTHER MODERNIZE THEIR PERMITTING SYSTEM BY CREATING A CLOUD HOSTED SOLUTION FOR THE ELECTRONIC SUBMISSION OF ENVIRONMENTAL PERMITS AND THEIR ASSOCIATED DATA. PROJECT GOALS INCLUDE MODERNIZING THE COLLECTION AND PROCESSING OF WATER PERMITS AND ASSOCIATED DATA.

AWARD PURPOSE: TO ENHANCE IT AND DATA MANAGEMENT CAPABILITIES THAT FACILITATE THE ELECTRONIC COLLECTION, REPORTING, EXCHANGE, SHARING AND INTEGRATION OF THE FULL RANGE OF DATA THAT INFORMS THE BUSINESS OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION. ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE: MODERNIZING THE COLLECTION AND PROCESSING OF WATER PERMITS AND ASSOCIATED DATA.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE: CONTRACT FOR NEEDED EXPERTISE; DEVELOPMENT OF A MODERN DATA COLLECTION SYSTEM; AND IMPLEMENTATION OF DATA VISUALIZATIONS; EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: FINDING AN EXPERIENCED CONTRACTOR READY TO PRODUCE THE SYSTEM; A MODERN, CLOUD-BASED PERMIT APPLICATION SYSTEM IN OPERATION; AND VISUALIZATIONS AVAILABLE ON THE CDPHE WEBSITE; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE: PERMITEES AND RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF COLORADO.

DESCRIPTION:THE WASHINGTON STATE POLLUTION LIABILITY INSURANCE AGENCY SEEKS TO TRANSPARENTLY AND EFFECTIVELY TRACK PETROLEUM CONTAMINATED LAND THAT IS NOT ASSIGNED A PARCEL NUMBER AND CANNOT CURRENTLY BE MANAGED USING DEED RESTRICTIONS. ITS COMPLETION WILL ALSO ENSURE THAT CITIES, COUNTIES AND OTHER STATE AGENCIES CAN EASILY AND EFFICIENTLY LOOK UP PETROLEUM CONTAMINATION ON NON-PARCELED LAND, SUCH AS RIGHTS-OF-WAY AND EASEMENTS THAT MAY IMPACT ROAD OR OTHER INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS AND IDENTIFY THE PARTY RESPONSIBLE FOR ITS CLEANUP AND COORDINATE THE CLEANUP WITH OTHER GROUND-DISTURBING ACTIVITIES.

AWARD PURPOSE: TO ENHANCE IT AND DATA MANAGEMENT CAPABILITIES THAT FACILITATE THE ELECTRONIC COLLECTION, REPORTING, EXCHANGE, SHARING AND INTEGRATION OF THE FULL RANGE OF DATA THAT INFORMS THE BUSINESS OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: DEVELOPING USE CASES TO DEMONSTRATE THE UTILITY OF THE STANDARDIZED DATA AND DATA EXCHANGE; DESIGNING THE TECHNICAL FRAMEWORK FOR THE CREATION OF AN ACCESSIBLE DATA COLLECTION OF NON-PARCELED, PETROLEUM CONTAMINATED LAND; AND DEVELOPING AN ENVIRONMENTAL DATA CATALOG PLATFORM.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE: A DATA SYSTEM THAT MAKES IT EASY FOR CITIES AND COUNTIES TO LOOK UP PETROLEUM CONTAMINATION ON NON-PARCELED LAND THAT MAY IMPACT ROAD OR OTHER INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS, IDENTIFY THE PARTY  RESPONSIBLE FOR ITS CLEANUP, AND COORDINATE THE CLEANUP WITH OTHER GROUND-DISTURBING ACTIVITIES.

EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: SOLID USE CASES AND STAKEHOLDER FEEDBACK UPON WHICH TO BUILD A SYSTEM THAT IS EFFECTIVE AT REDUCING BARRIERS TO CLEANING UP RESIDUAL PETROLEUM CONTAMINATION FROM LEAKING USTS; AN ACCESSIBLE FRAMEWORK FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF A DATA STORAGE AND DISSEMINATION SYSTEM THAT IS INTEROPERABLE WITH OTHER STATE AGENCIES' GEOSPATIAL DATA SYSTEMS, AND ACCESSIBLE TO OUTSIDE STAKEHOLDERS; AND A COMPLETED APPLICATION THAT PROVIDES IMPORTANT DATA ABOUT NON-PARCELED PETROLEUM-CONTAMINATED PROPERTIES TO PUBLIC AND PRIVATE ENTITIES WHO ARE PLANNING GROUND-DISTURBING WORK. THE SYSTEM WILL ALLOW THEM TO LOOK UP THE LOCATION OF THEIR PROPOSED PROJECT AND WILL  THEM TO RESIDUAL CONTAMINATION AS WELL AS PROVIDE LAST KNOWN CONTACT INFORMATION FOR ANY PARTIES RESPONSIBLE FOR THE CONTAMINATION.

INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE: CITIES, COUNTIES, AND STATE AGENCIES INTERESTED IN OBTAINING INFORMATION ABOUT PETROLEUM-CONTAMINATED LAND IN THE STATE OF UTAH.

DESCRIPTION:WESTERN NEVADA COLLEGE SEEKS TO FURTHER EXPAND THE TECHNICAL AND MAPPING CAPABILITIES OF GREENBITRACKER (GBT) TO ENABLE GREEN BUSINESS PROGRAMS ACROSS THE NATION TO BETTER IDENTIFY ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES AND TO BETTER PROVIDE SERVICES TO THEM. THE PROJECT GOALS ARE TO REDUCE EMISSIONS BY PROVIDING INFORMATION ON GREEN BUSINESS PROGRAMS NATIONALLY, PROMOTE ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE, DETECT VIOLATIONS AND PROPOTE COMPLIANCE, AND ENSURE CHEMICAL AND PESTICIDE SAFETY.

AWARD PURPOSE: TO ENHANCE IT AND DATA MANAGEMENT CAPABILITIES THAT FACILITATE THE ELECTRONIC COLLECTION, REPORTING, EXCHANGE, SHARING AND INTEGRATION OF THE FULL RANGE OF DATA THAT INFORMS THE BUSINESS OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE: ASSISTING SMALL AND MEDIUM SIZED BUSINESSES WITH TECHNOLOGY AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO TRACK GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS AND MAKE STRATEGIC CHANGES IN THEIR OPERATIONS TO REDUCE EMISSIONS; DEVELOPING MEASURES AND TECHNIQUES IN GREENBIZTRACKER THAT ALLOW BUSINESSES TO BE MORE RESILIENT AND ADAPTABLE IN THE FACE OF CLIMATE CHANGE;  INTRODUCING THE GREEN BUSINESS MODEL INTERNATIONALLY TO THE MAYORS OF THE C40 CITIES; OFFERING THE USE OF GREENBIZTRACKER AS A DIGITAL GREEN BUSINESS PROGRAM AND AN EFFECTIVE AND PROVEN MEANS TO WORK WITH SMALL AND MEDIUM SIZED BUSINESSES TO REDUCE GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS; AUTOMATING COMPLIANCE CHECKS THROUGH GBT FOR PROGRAMS AND FACILITATING COMPLIANCE EDUCATION OF NEWER ENVIRONMENTAL LAWS; USING GBT CHECKLISTS TO PROMOTE GREENER CHEMISTRY ALTERNATIVES FOR SMALL BUSINESS SECTORS; AND USING GBT FRAMEWORK AND CHECKLISTS TO PROMOTE STORM WATER AND WASTEWATER POLLUTION PREVENTION.SUBRECIPIENT:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE NEVADA SYSTEM OF HIGHER EDUCATION WILL WORK WITH CALIFORNIA TO FURTHER EXPAND THE TECHNICAL AND MAPPING CAPABILITIES OF GREENBIZTRACKER(GBT) IN ORDER TO ENABLE GREEN BUSINESS PROGRAMS ACROSS THE NATION AND BETTER IDENTIFY ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES IN ORDER TO PROVIDE SERVICES TO THEM. TOOLS AND MEASURES WOULD BE ADDED TO GBT TO ALLOW BUSINESSES TO BE MORE RESILIENT AND ADAPTABLE IN THE FACE OF CLIMATE CHANGE. A LARGE EMPHASIS WOULD BE ON DEVELOPING TRAINING AND EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS TO BETTER UTILIZE THE MYRIAD OF CAPABILITIES THAT EXIST WITHIN GBT AND OTHER OPEN-SOURCED TECHNOLOGIES IN USE THAT ARE NOT UNDERSTOOD OR BEING FULLY UTILIZED. WE WILL TEST PILOT ALL THE NEW TOOLS IN NEVADA BEFORE NATIONWIDE  ROLLOUT VIA THE  GREEN  BUSINESS  ENGAGEMENT  NATIONAL  NETWORK(GBENN)FOR  BROAD SHARING AND REACH. ALL NEW DATA TOOLS WILL BE OPEN SOURCED THROUGH THE NEIEN PROGRAM.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE: ELECTRIFICATION, EV ADOPTION, ENERGY EFFICIENCY, WASTE ELIMINATION AND WATER CONSERVATION. 

EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS REDUCTIONS IN METRIC TONS (CO2 EQUIVALENT); NUMBER OF BUSINESSES NATIONALLY THAT IMPLEMENT CLIMATE RESILIENCE/ADAPTATION MEASURES AND WHAT THOSE MEASURES ARE; PRESENTATION TO AT LEAST 5 INTERNATIONAL CITIES AND OFFER LICENSES TO GREENBIZTRACKER; INCREASE IN NUMBER OF BIPOC OWNED BUSINESSES, OF EJ COMMUNITIES SERVED THAT WERE PREVIOUSLY AVOIDED, AND IN BUSINESS ACTIVITY IN EJ COMMUNITIES; AUTOMATED COMPLIANCE CHECKS IN AT LEAST 3 STATES TO FACILITATE DETECTING COMPLIANCE; FACILITATION AND TRACKING OF COMPLIANCE EDUCATION IN NEWER LAWS; INCREASE IN NUMBER OF GBT STATES/USERS UTILIZING MEASURES PERTAINING TO GREENER CHEMISTRIES; AND INCREASE IN MEASURES ADOPTION AND TRACKING PERTAINING TO STORM WATER AND WASTEWATER POLLUTION PREVENTION. 

INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE: ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES; AND SMALL TO MEDIUM BUSINESSES THAT WANT TO REDUCE EMISSIONS AND COMPLY WITH ENVIRONMENTAL LAWS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL UPGRADE THE NORTHWEST INDIAN FISHERIES COMMISSION'S EXISTING WATER QUALITY EXCHANGE SYSTEM CALLED TRIBAL WATER QUALITY DATA EXCHANGE (TWQD) TO ALIGN WITH THE NEW WQX 3.0 SCHEMA DEFINITION. THIS WILL BRING THE EXISTING EXCHANGE UP TO THE CURRENT EPA STANDARDS.

AWARD PURPOSE: TO ENHANCE IT AND DATA MANAGEMENT CAPABILITIES THAT FACILITATE THE ELECTRONIC COLLECTION, REPORTING, EXCHANGE, SHARING AND INTEGRATION OF THE FULL RANGE OF DATA THAT INFORMS THE BUSINESS OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION. ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE: ORGANIZING PROJECT GOVERNANCE; DESIGNING DATA FLOW FOR THE UPGRADE OF THE TRIBAL WATER QUALITY DATA EXCHANGE TO THE WQX 3.0 SCHEMA; UPGRADING TWQD EXCHANGE NETWORK FLOW TO THE WQX 3.0 SCHEMA; ENHANCING THE CURRENT TRIBAL WATER QUALITY WEBMAP TO ENABLE THE VIEWING OF TRIBAL WATER QUALITY DATA AND PERFORM ANALYSIS OF DATA WITH REGARD TO ADJACENT SPATIAL INFORMATION; AND DEPLOYING, TRAINING AND MENTORING FOR THE TWQD DATA EXCHANGE.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE: ESTABLISHMENT OF THE BUSINESS TEAM (TECHNICAL, DATA FLOW AND CLIENT APPLICATION) AND THE GOVERNANCE PROCESS; DEVELOPMENT OF DATABASE AND XML SCHEMA; DEVELOPMENT OF WEBMAP AND TOOLS THAT PERMIT TRIBES TO LOAD THEIR OWN DATA; REGIONAL AND LOCAL DATA IS LOADED INTO WEBMAP FOR SPATIAL ANALYSIS OF RIPARIAN AND FLOODPLAIN DATA; AN ESRI ARCGIS SERVER WEBMAP IS PUBLISHED; AND REGIONAL AND INDIVIDUAL TRIBAL TRAINING SESSIONS ARE CONDUCTED AND COMPLETE.

EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: TRIBES WILL BE ABLE TO MANAGE AND SHARE DATA IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE CURRENT EPA WQX 3.0 SCHEMA; BE BETTER EQUIPPED TO DETECT VIOLATIONS AND PROMOTE COMPLIANCE BY BEING IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE EPA WQX 3.0 SCHEMA; AND WILL HAVE A WATER QUALITY DATA MANAGEMENT PLATFORM THAT WILL SUPPORT THEIR INDIVIDUAL NEEDS.

INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE: THE COMMISSION'S 20 MEMBER TRIBES AND OTHER NON-MEMBER TRIBES WHO UTILIZE THE COMMISSION'S EXISTING WATER QUALITY EXCHANGE.

DESCRIPTION:THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL ALLOW THE CALIFORNIA STATE WATER RESOURCES CONTROL BOARD TO ENHANCE EXISTING AND NEW DATA FLOWS BY ROUTING THEM THROUGH VES INSTEAD OF THE CALIFORNIA ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY'S (CALEPA) PHYSICAL NODE, DEVELOP A LIMIT AND MONITORING REQUIREMENT EXTRACTION TOOL THAT GENERATES XML CODES BASED ON NPDES PERMIT REQUIREMENTS THAT WILL BE FLOWED TO USEPA'S SYSTEM (ICIS), CREATE THE FLOW FOR SANITARY SEWER OVERFLOW DATA AS REQUIRED BY THE EREPORTING RULE, AND CONDUCT AN AUDIT OF THE CRADLE TO GRAVE DATA EXCHANGE PROCESS.

AWARD PURPOSE: TO ENHANCE IT AND DATA MANAGEMENT CAPABILITIES THAT FACILITATE THE ELECTRONIC COLLECTION, REPORTING, EXCHANGE, SHARING AND INTEGRATION OF THE FULL RANGE OF DATA THAT INFORMS THE BUSINESS OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION.
ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE: IMPLEMENTING VES; POPULATING NPDES LIMITS ELECTRONICALLY IN ICIS AND SSO DATA FLOWS; AND INCREASING DATA QUALITY.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE: SYSTEM ARCHITECTURE DESIGN AND DATA FLOW DOCUMENT; MODIFICATION AND DOCUMENTATION OF ETL AND DATA FLOWS; DEVELOPMENT, DOCUMENTATION, AND EXECUTION OF TEST AND IMPLEMENTATION PLANS; ESTABLISHMENT OF SSO DATA FLOW TO ICIS; REGISTRATION OF DEVELOPED RESOURCES IN RCS AND ENDS; AND DEVELOPMENT OF AN AUDIT FRAMEWORK.

EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: RELIABLE DATA EXCHANGE OF DMR DATA TO ICIS-NPDES THROUGH VES; REDUCE RELIANCE ON CALEPA'S ONSITE HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE MAINTENANCE;  NODE OPERATIONAL REQUIREMENTS STANDARDIZED TO A NATIONAL GUIDELINE; ICIS POPULATED ELECTRONICALLY WITH PERMIT LIMITS AND MONITORING REQUIREMENTS AND SSO DATA FLOW FROM CIWQS TO ICIS; FEWER FALSE POSITIVE VIOLATIONS IN ICIS; REDUCTION IN STAFF TIME NEEDED INVESTIGATING DATA PROBLEMS; AND FEWER UNRESOLVED QUESTIONS REGARDING DMR LIMIT SETS.

INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE: CALIFORNIA DATA CONSUMERS AND PERMITEES.

DESCRIPTION:THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL ALLOW THE HAWAII DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH TO CENTRALIZE ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH INFORMATION TO ALLOW EHA STAFF TO CONNECT CROSS-PROGRAM COMPLAINT, INVESTIGATION, VIOLATION, ENFORCEMENT, AND INCIDENT ENVIRONMENTAL INTEREST DATA FOR IMPROVED COMPLIANCE, ENFORCEMENT, AND SUPPORT OF EMERGENCY RESPONSE. PROJECT GOALS INCLUDE THE DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF INNOVATIVE SHARED SERVICES FOR THE ACCESSIBILITY AND QUERYING OF COMPLAINT, INVESTIGATION, VIOLATION, ENFORCEMENT, AND INCIDENT EVENT DATA AND PROVIDING RELATED ENVIRONMENTAL INTERESTS GEOSPATIALLY. PRIORITIZED DATA SETS INCLUDE COMPLAINT AND ENFORCEMENT RECORDS FROM CLEAN AIR, CLEAN WATER AND SOLID WASTE SYSTEMS AND INCIDENT SAMPLE EVENT DATA FROM THE NAVY DRINKING WATER SYSTEM INCIDENT. 

AWARD PURPOSE: TO ENHANCE IT AND DATA MANAGEMENT CAPABILITIES THAT FACILITATE THE ELECTRONIC COLLECTION, REPORTING, EXCHANGE, SHARING AND INTEGRATION OF THE FULL RANGE OF DATA THAT INFORMS THE BUSINESS OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION.
ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE: CENTRALIZING COMPLAINT DATA FROM CLEAN AIR, CLEAN WATER, AND SOLID WASTE BRANCH SYSTEMS; SHARING ENFORCEMENT DATA FROM THE CLEAN AIR, CLEAN WATER AND SOLID WASTE SYSTEMS; SHARING NAVY DRINKING WATER SYSTEM INCIDENT (NWSI) DATA; SHARING SENSITIVE DATA SPATIALLY FROM THE CLEAN AIR, CLEAN WATER SOLID WASTE BRANCH SYSTEMS AND NAVY WATER SYSTEM INCIDENT; AND SECURING USER INTERFACES AND CAPABILITIES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE: COMPLAINT DATA ACCESS SERVICES FOR SHARING COMPLAINT AND INQUIRY DATA; COMPLAINT DATA SEARCH AND VIEW SERVICES FOR QUERYING COMPLAINT AND INQUIRY DATA; ENFORCEMENT DATA ACCESS SERVICES FOR SHARING INVESTIGATION, VIOLATION, AND ENFORCEMENT ACTION DATA; ENFORCEMENT DATA SEARCH AND VIEW SERVICES FOR QUERYING INVESTIGATION, VIOLATION, AND ENFORCEMENT ACTION DATA; INCIDENT SAMPLE DATA ACCESS SERVICES FOR SHARING INCIDENT SAMPLE EVENT DATA; INCIDENT SAMPLE DATA SEARCH AND VIEW SERVICES FOR QUERYING INCIDENT SAMPLE EVENT DATA; COMPLAINT AND ENFORCEMENT LOCATION SERVICES; INCIDENT SAMPLE LOCATION SERVICES; COMPLAINT, ENFORCEMENT, AND INCIDENT SAMPLE EVENT SPATIAL VIEWER CAPABILITIES; USER AUTHENTICATION FEATURE TO INTEGRATE EHACONNECT APPLICATION SYSTEM WITH EHA IDENTITY SERVICES TO PROVIDE USER AUTHENTICATION AND ROLES; AND EHACONNECT ROLE-BASED VIEWS TO TAILOR THE USER EXPERIENCE FOR PUBLIC USERS AND EHA AUTHENTICATED USERS.

EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: CENTRALIZED SENSITIVE COMPLAINT DATA WILL PROVIDE REAL-TIME VISIBILITY OF CROSS-PROGRAM COMPLAINTS TO SUPPORT EMERGENCY RESPONSE AND MAKE EVIDENCE-BASED ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH DECISIONS; CENTRALIZED SENSITIVE ENFORCEMENT DATA WILL PROVIDE REAL-TIME VISIBILITY OF CROSS-PROGRAM INVESTIGATIONS, VIOLATIONS, AND ENFORCEMENT ACTIONS TO SUPPORT EMERGENCY RESPONSE AND MAKE DECISIONS; SHARING SENSITIVE INCIDENT RESPONSE AND INVESTIGATION DATA WILL PROVIDE REAL-TIME VALUE-ADDED DRINKING WATER SAMPLE DATA TO CROSS-PROGRAM ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH INTERESTS TO SUPPORT EMERGENCY RESPONSE, DETECT VIOLATIONS AND MAKE EVIDENCE-BASED ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH DECISIONS; CENTRALIZED SENSITIVE COMPLAINT, ENFORCEMENT AND INCIDENT DATA LOCATIONS WILL PROVIDE REAL-TIME GEOSPATIAL VISIBILITY OF CROSS-PROGRAM COMPLAINTS, INVESTIGATIONS, VIOLATIONS, ENFORCEMENT ACTIONS AND INCIDENT SAMPLE EVENTS TO SUPPORT EMERGENCY RESPONSE AND MAKE EVIDENCE-BASED DECISIONS; AND SECURE USER ROLE-BASED CROSS-PROGRAM VIEWS AND CAPABILITIES TO SUPPORT OPERATIONS, EMERGENCY RESPONSE, DETECT VIOLATIONS AND MAKE EVIDENCE-BASED ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH DECISIONS.

INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE: STATE OF HAWAII.

DESCRIPTION:

THE REQUESTED FUNDS WILL BE USED TO PREPARE DATA AND PROCESSES FOR THIS NEW INTEGRATION AND DESIGN AND DEVELOP AN INTERFACE IN THE ENABLE SYSTEM TO SUPPORT THE INTEGRATION WITH THE NEW EPA SRF DATABASE. THE ENERGY-WATER-EMISSIONS DASHBOARD (EWED) WILL INTEGRATE THREE EN DATA SOURCES AND OTHER FEDERAL DATA SOURCES INTO A NEW WEB SERVICE AND TWO WEB-BASED USER INTERFACES THAT SUPPORT INTEGRATED DECISION MAKING AND PLANNING AT THE ENERGY-WATER-CLIMATE NEXUS. THE EWED USER INTERFACES WILL INCLUDE A NEAR-REAL-TIME DASHBOARD OF POWER PLANT FACILITY WATER DEMANDS AND EMISSIONS, AS WELL AS ADVANCED TOOLS FOR USERS TO PERFORM DETAILED ANALYSES AND SCENARIO DEVELOPMENT AT DIFFERENT GEOGRAPHIC AND JURISDICTIONAL SCALES. THE GOAL OF EWED IS TO IMPROVE INTEGRATION, ACCESSIBILITY, USABILITY, AND TIMELINESS OF COMPLEX ENVIRONMENTAL DATA.

THIS PROJECT WILL IMPROVE RADON DATA FLOWS AND COORDINATE RADON DATA FLOW TO AN EXCHANGE NETWORK (EN) NODE OR VIRTUAL NETWORK FROM PARTNER STATES IN ORDER TO INCREASE THE FLOW OF RADON DATA THHROUGH EN.

THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE FOR ENHANCEMENTS TO LEVERAGE AND IMPROVE UPON NEW FEATURES THAT FOND DU LAC BAND OF CHIPPEWA ANTICIPATE BEING ADDED TO AWQMS FOR IMPLEMENTING THE ASSESSMENT TMDL TRACKING AND IMPLEMENTATION SYSTEM (ATTAINS) EN DATA FLOW, AND THE USE OF AWQMS AS A CONTINUOUS WATER QUALITY SENSOR DATA 'APPLIANCE' VIA WEB SERVICES.  THE PROJECT ALSO INTENDS TO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS FOR CONTINUOUS MONITORING DATA CAPTURE AND MANAGEMENT, AND CONTINUOUS MONITORING SENSOR METADATA SUBMISSION TO NATIONAL CENTRAL CATALOG.  IN ADDITION, THE TRIBE PROPOSE TO IMPLEMENT NEW INFORMATION VISUALIZTION TOOLS IN THE FORM OF 'DASHBOARDS' AND CIS IMPROVEMENTS FOR THE MULTITUDE OF AWQMS TRIBAL, STATE, AND VOLUNTEER USERS.

THIS PROJECT WILL 1) RECORD ASSESSMENT DECISIONS IN AWQMS AND SUBMIT THE ASSESSMENT DATA FROM AWQMS TO THE NEW ATTAINS EXCHANGE NETWORK DATA FLOW; 2) IMPROVE GROUNDWATER TRACKING AND ANALYSIS CAPABILITIES, INCLUDING CONTINUOUS MONITORING DATA; 3) IMPROVE THE TRACKING OF HABITAT ASSESSMENT DATA IN ORDER TO BETTER ASSESS THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA'S WATER; AND 4) IMPLEMENT IMPROVED LAKE PROFILE RECORDING, REPORTING AND ANALYSIS FOR BETTER ASSESSMENT OUT OKLAHOMA'S WATERS.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO ACQUIRE FUNDING TO SUPPORT MINNESOTA DOH, DRINKING WATER PROTECTION (DWP) SECTION TO: DEVELOP AN INTERACTIVE ELECTRONIC FIELD INSPECTON TOOL (E-INSPECTION TOOL) FOR PUBLIC WATER SYSTEM SUPERVISION (PWSS) SANITARY SURVEY AND SOURCES WATER PROTECTION PROGRAM, TO ROLLOUT A DWP E-INSPECTION PRGRAM; USE THE E-INSPECTION DEVICE TO PROVIDE TO MINNESOTA PUBLIC WATER SYSTEMS (PWSS) ONSITE COMPLIANCE MONITORING DATA PORTAL (CMDP) USERS TRAINING.
THIS PROJECT WILL ADOPT AND DEPLOY THE COMPLIANCE MONITORING DATA PORTAL (CMDP); AND ADOPT AND DEPLOY SAFE DRINKING WATER INFORMATION SYSTEM (SDWIS) PRIME.

THE KSDHE PROPOSES TO DEVELOP A WEB BASED APPLICAITON THAT RECEIVES THE NATIONAL POLLUTANT DISCHARGE ELIMINATION SYSTEM (NPDES) EREPORTING RULE REQUIRED INFORMATION (PHASE 2) FROM NPDES PERMITTEES, IS COMPATIBLE WITH THE INTEGRATED COMPLIANCE INFORMATION SYSTEM-NATIONAL POLLUTANT DISCHARGE ELIMINATION SYSTEM (ICIS-NPDES) IN AN EXTENSIBLE MARKUP LANGUAGE (XML) SCHEMA FORMAT AND CAN UPLOAD THE THE DATA VIA A BATCHED SYSTEM (OPEN NODE) TO EPA'S ICIS; AND DEVELOP A SOLUTION THAT FACIILITATES THE EXCHAGE OF STATE LISTING AND TMDL DATA TO THE EPA ATTAINS'S WEB-BASED APPLICATION.

THIS PROJECT WILL DEVELOP A FINANCIAL REPORTING SYSTEM FOR WATER AND WASTEWATER SYSTEMS IN NORTH CAROLINA AND TO FACILITATE INTEGRATION AND VISUALIZATION OF WATER AND WASTEWATER SYSTEM FINANCIAL DATA IN A FINANCIAL SUSTAINABILITY AND RATES DASHBOARD.

THIS PROJECT WILL MAKE PUBLICLY AVAILABLE DATA FOR THOUSANDS OF WATER QUALITY AND NUTRIENT CHEMISTRY MONITORING SITES IN INDIANA'S PORTION OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER AND GREAT LAKES BASINS WHILE ALSO DEVELOPING VALUE-ADDED WEB-BASED ANALYTICAL AND VISUALIZATION TOOLS FOR THESE DATA. SPECIFICALLY, WE PROPOSE TO AUGMENT THE DATA AND MODELING TOOLS OF TWO EXISTING WEB APPLICATIONS, THE GREAT LAKES TO GULF VIRTUAL OBSERVATORY, AND THE GREAT LAKES MONITORING WEB APP. TOGETHER THESE GOALS WILL INCREASE THE AMOUNT OF DATA AVAILABLE TO BOTH OF THESE TOOLS AND ENHANCES THE ANALYTICAL AND VISUALIZATION CAPABLILTY OF THE TWO WEB APPS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS PROJECT WILL UTILIZE EPA'S CURRENT CONTINUOUS WATER MONITORING EXCHANGE FRAMEWORK (WATER ML 2.0 AND SENSOR ML FORMATS) TO SHARE CONTINUOUS WATER QUALITY DATA AND ITS ASSOCIATED METADATA; WILL ENCODE CONTINUOUS AIR QUALITY SENSOR DATA BASED ON THE SAME PROCEDURES AND FRAMEWORK ESTABLISHED FOR CONTINUOUS WATER QUALITY DATA; WILL CONFIGURE DATA FLOWS AND TEST THE EXTENSIBLE MARKUP LANGUAGE (XML) SCHEMA FOR SHARING DISCRETE SEASONAL WATER QUALITY DATA THROUGH EPA'S WQX SYSTEM; AND, WILL CONFIGURE DATA FLOWS AND TEST EXISTING XML SCHEMA TO UPLOAD FACILITY REGISTRY DATA AND LOCATION VIA THE VIRTUAL EXCHANGE SERVICES TO EPA'S FACILITY REGISTRY SERVICE.

THIS PROJECT WILL ADD AND IMPROVE TOOLS FOR SEARCHILNG, ANALYZING AND DISPLAYING DATA IN AMBIENT WATER QUALITY MONITORING SYSTEM (AWQMS); IMPLEMENT TO A PROJECT DASHBOARD TO PROVIDE A QUICK SUMMARY OF DATA REPORTING AND TRACKING CAPABILITIES; LEVERAGE THE WATER QUALITY PORTAL (WQP) WEB SERVICE FROM WITHIN THE ALASKA AWQMS INSTANCE; AND STREAMLINE THE FLOW OF DATA FROM THE NARS MOBILE APPLICATION INTO AWQMS.

UNDER THIS PROJECT, THE NEVADA DEP WILL DEVELOP A SYSTEM FOR ELECTRONIC REPORTING OF AIR EMISSION DATA FROM REGULATED FACILITIES TO THE DEP; ADOPT AND DEPLOY THE COMPLIANCE MONITORING DATA PORTAL (CMDP) FOR REPORTING OF PUBLIC WATER SYSTEM DATA; AND, MODIFY OR RETOOL THEIR EXISTING DRINKING WATER OPERATOR MANAGEMENT SYSTEM, SAFE WATER OPERATOR CERTIFICATION SYSTEM (SWOCS), FROM AN OPEN DATABASE CONNECTIVITY (ODBC) CONNECTION TO A SYSTEM THAT UTILIZES WEB SERVICE CALLS.

THE PRIMARY GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO FULLY AUTOMATE THE DATA TRANSMISSION OF DRINKING WATER TEST RESULTS BETWEEN OPENELIS, THE LABORATORY INFORMATION MANAGEMENT SYSTEM (LIMS) USED FOR MANAGING SAFE DRINKING WATER ACT TESTING AT THE SHL, AND THE CLOUD-BASED SDWIS PRIME DATABASE VIA THE COMPLIANCE MONITORING DATA PORTAL (CMDP). THIS GOAL CAN BE ACCOMPLISHED BY COMBINING THE LIMS WITH AN INTEGRATION ENGINE THAT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR TRANSFORMING AND DELIVERING THE DATA TO CMDP THROUGH REST API. THIS FUNDING, WILL PROVIDE RESOURCES TO BUILD THE CAPABILITY WITHIN OUR RHAPSODY INTEGRATION ENGINE TO TRANSFORM AND DELIVER RESULTS TO CMDP. THIS APPROACH ALLOWS OTHER ENVIRONMENTAL AND PUBLIC HEALTH LABORATORIES (PHEL) TO BENEFIT FROM THIS WORK BY 1) LEVERAGING EXISTING INTEGRATION ENGINES THAT ARE CURRENTLY USED FOR DELIVERING CLINICAL AND DISEASE CONTROL RESULTS AND 2) REUSE THE PHEL TO CMDP INTERFACE THAT WE WILL DEVELOP.

THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE IMPROVED EXCHANGE OF, AND ACCESS TO, WATER QUALITY DATA BETWEEN TRIBES AND THE EPA. THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE FOR FURTHER ENHANCEMENTS FOR QUALITY ASSURANCE, DATA ANALYSIS, AND REPORTING CAPABILITIES OF OUR HOSTED WQX COMPATIBLE DATABASE TO MEET REQUIREMENTS OF THE EPA NATIONAL STRATEGIC PLAN AND TRIBE-SPECIFIC REPORTING NEEDS.

THIS PROJECT WILL CREATE A NATIONAL TRIBAL MENTORING PROGRAM; DEVELOP AN ATTAINS WEBPAGE ON THE INTER-TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL COUNCIL WEBSITE; PROVIDE LOGISTICAL SUPPORT AND COORDINATE FOR TRIBES TO RECEIVE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE WITH THE UTILIZATTION OF THE ATTAINS REPORTING TOOL; PERFORM TECHNICAL OUTREACH EFFORTS FOR THE ATTAINS REPORTING TOOL; AND CREATE AND PUBLISH A NEWSLETTER THAT WILL SHOWCASE THE ATTAINS REPORTING TOOL FOR THE TRIBAL WATER PROGRAM.

THE STATE IS CREATING A UNIFIED TANKS DATABASE AND SOFTWARE SYSTEM WITH A WEB INTERFACE.THE PROJECT UNITES THE DATA COLLECTION AND DATA FLOW FOR FOUR PROGRAMS: THE UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK PROGRAM, THE ABOVEGROUND STORAGE TANK PROGRAM, THE LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK PROGRAM, AND THE LEAKING ABOVEGROUND STORAGE TANK PROGRAM. A MOBILE INSPECTION TOOL WILL ENHANCE DATA COLLECTION AND REPORTING, AND THE CREATION OF WEB PORTALS WILL FACILITATE DATA EXCHANGE TO NUMEROUS STAKEHOLDERS.

THE COLORADO DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENT (CDPHE) PROPOSED TO SUMMARIZE THE DEPARTMENT'S APPROACH TO DATA MANAGEMENT, AND PROGRESS TOWARD NODE IMPLEMENTATION AND DATA INTEGRATION, AND COMMITMENTS FOR FURTHER DATA EXCHANGES AND INTEGRATION THAT WILL BE IMPLEMENTED WITH THE RECEIPT OF THIS GRANT.
THE VIRGINIA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH PROPOSES TO TRANSITION SAFE DRINKING WATER INFORMATION SYSTEM STATE TO SDWIS PRIME.

THIS PROPOSAL CONSISTS OF THREE GOALS: THE FIRST IS TO UPDATE AND EXPAND THE EXISTING OIL AND GAS ONLINE SYSTEM FOR PERMITTING AND REPORTING. THE SECOND GOAL IS TO INTEGRATE AN OIL AND GAS EMISSIONS REPORTING SYSTEM INTO THE CENTRALIZED AIR EMISSIONS REPORTING SYSTEM (CAERS) ONLINE DATABASE. THE THIRD GOAL IS TO CREATE UT DIVISION OF AIR QUALITY (DAQ) BRIDGE TOOL FOR AUTOMATED UPLOAD OF OIL AND GAS (O & G) INVENTORIES TO THE EMISSIONS INVENTORY SYSTEM (EIS).

THIS PROJECT WILL CREATE NEW EXCHANGE NETWORK DATA FLOWS FOR THE SOUTH DAKOTA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT AND NATURAL RESOURCES (DENR) AND ALSO IMPROVE ACCESS AND AVAILABILITY OF ENVIRONMENTAL DATA TO INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL USERS. THIS PROJECT WILL UPGRADE TWO EXISTING DATA FLOWS (AQS AND WQX) AND CREATE ONE NEW FLOW (RADON MITIGATION), ENHANCE A PRIOR GRANT-DEVELOPED BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE COMPONENT, AND ESTABLISH AN OPEN DATA PORTAL FOR ENVIRONMENTAL DATA FOR THE COMMONWEALTH IN CONJUNCTION WITH NATIONAL ON-GOING EFFORTS AT BOTH EPA AND CDC.

THE PROJECT WILL INCREASE THE STATE'S ENVIRONMENTAL DATA AVAILABILITY FOR INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL CONSUMPTION. THE MUTLISENSOR DATA SET IS EXTENSIVELY USED BY STATES, INTEREST GROUPS, ADVOCACY ORGANIZATIONS, THE REGULATED COMMUNITY, AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC. THUS THE DATASET WILL REACH A BROAD AUDIENCE, INCLUDING DATA BEING CATALOGED DATA WITH WQX. THE STATE IS COMMITTED TO PACKAGING ITS PRODUCT(S) FOR DISTRIBUTION TO ORGANIZATIONS WHO ALSO NEED A SIMILAR DATA SOLUTION.

THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO INCREASE THE QUALITY AND AVAILABILITY OF GEOSPATIAL DATA FOR RESUMPTION OF FLOW TO FACILITY REGISTRY SYSTEM (FRS) AND FOR NEW FLOWS TO EPA'S CENTRAL DATA EXCHANGE (CDX). THE PROJECT WILL ALSO CREATE A WEB SERVICE TO SUPPORT EMERGENCY PLANNING, RESPONSE, AND RECOVERY IN THE EVENT OF STREAM CROSSING FAILURES DURING FLOODS.
